name: Sofitel Montreal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights in June and while we had no major issues with it we were glad that we had managed to get the room at a reduced corporate rate as we wouldn't have wanted to pay more than we did.
reviews.title: Fine but a bit noisy

reviews.text: Main issue was that we were on 12th floor but the noise from the main road is very loud given you are that high up. Perhaps. Room on the side or back would be better as on the front there is no real view anyway.
reviews.title: An outstanding place to stay for a wonderful holiday

reviews.text: The room was fine but bathroom a little small.
reviews.title: Empowered staff, nicely appointed rooms, excellent location!

reviews.text: Exactly what I expect from a 5 star Hotel (very clean, trendy, luxurious, great service, amazing staff, 5 stars amenities, great layout, comfortable trendy rooms,..etc), except for the breakfast and views from your rooms (breaksfasts are too pricey for what they are. They also lack for freshness since I found my benedict eggs to be cold and fruits not that fresh). I was leaving on 10th floor (room 1004) and am being told by some buddies who frequently stay there that that part has the best views I can get from the windows: well, I had couple of rental-buildings in front and a piece of Sherbrooke street on the side...not horrific, but not awesome neither. Overall, a hotel I would highly recommend.
reviews.title: Exactly what I expect from a 5 star Hotel, except for the breakfast and views

likes.liked: — Luxury of the hotel, clean, great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I thought our stay was "OK" but it certainly wasn't the best Sofitel hotel that we've used - for some reason it feels very bland when compared to those in New York, Paris or Amsterdam? Certainly not much colour or style in the rooms....
reviews.title: Central, comfortable and a little bit bland

reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights (for my Birthday) at the end of June. I can't remember the rate as it was booked via British Airways.
reviews.title: poor custmer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby is stylish and the reception staff were welcoming but I did notice that whenever we were passing through reception, the staff seemed to congregate and chat around the reception/concierge desk - which doesn't look very professional.
reviews.title: Classy hotel with the very best people taking care of you

reviews.text: The room was a corner room on the 16th floor - not much of a view from the front of the hotel and the noise from the traffic was noticeable which surprised me (as did the guests who liked to stand chatting loudly whilst waiting for the elevators late at night - soundproofing was not brilliant and they should address this but I accept that other people's behaviour isn't the fault of the hotel)
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: I really resent hotels these days that charge:

reviews.title: Loved the hotel & Location!

reviews.text: $11 for a pint of Guinness ($6.50 in Calgary)

reviews.text: ...and doesn't have a coffee perc in the room in order to force you to use room service at $10 per large pot. (+plus the room service charge and the "gratuity", like - thanks for the "service" Sofitel!)
reviews.title: The Love is in the Details

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were great, service in restaurant and bar excellent, but they boost the rev par by gouging customers for these things that we are now taking for granted. I get free hi-speed and a coffee machine in a Days Inn for Pete's sake!
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: Good hotel, nice rooms, service is as you can expect. Breakfast is a la card, good bit expensive. 20+ for am ommelet and 6 for coffee or orange juice. The gym is very small and has a time limit not what you can expect. All in all good hotel but prices are high and nothing is outstanding.
reviews.title: Great as you can expect

reviews.text: I was really disappointed by this hotel. The superior room are very basic, tiny and outdated, the sofa was dirty. I can't imagine what you get for the regular rooms. The service is poor and not friendly. We ate at the restaurant which was ok but a little pricey. I can't understand how this hotel gets 5 stars, it is more a 2/3 stars in my view. I largely prefer the Omni (close to the Sofitel) which is much higher range or the Hilton Garden Hill.
reviews.title: Not a five stars

reviews.text: The hotel's service was excellent and the rooms modern and clean. The restaurant at the hotel had an excellent menu. The food was superb, but bit pricey, but you do get a lot of food. The location was sort of central.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Sofitel for a 2-day business trip. I had a wonderful experience during my whole stay and would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel right in the heart of Montreal

reviews.text: The service of the staff was friendly and timely, and they were able to speak both English and French very well. The concierge provided us with wonderful dinner and cocktail restaurants and was knowledgable about the different types of cuisine each restaurant offered.
reviews.title: Excellent (Mostly)

reviews.text: I stayed at the Sofitel for several nights because it was pet friendly and I had my dog with me. They were wonderful from the beginning. Very friendly and accomidating. I checked in very early and they immediately found me a room. The room is certainly not huge but very modern and great views. Although I did hear several doors closing early in the morning I did not hear any other noise all night. The employees were friendly and helpful. There is a nice gym and pleasant restaurant. My only complaint is no coffee maker in the room. Great location on Sherbrooke and close to shopping and restaurants
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: Our family of 4 stayed in two rooms at the Sofitel Montreal for a week. We had a corner Superior King room. Our children had a Deluxe room with 2 double beds.
reviews.title: Very Good Choice

likes.liked: — Very Clean and quiet; great location for dining and shopping.
likes.disliked: — Storage Space in the superior room, bed linens and beds could be better.

reviews.text: Great location in an upscale residential and business area. Safe, clean and many cafes and dining options in walking distance.
reviews.title: Would recommend it

reviews.text: Each room had floor to ceiling windows. The corner room had windows on two sides. The A/C was effective and quiet in each room. The rooms were very clean and quiet. The Deluxe room is larger than the superior (which is a very good size), with much more storage space and a tub as well as shower in the bathroom. The storage space in the superior room was inadaqute for 2 people staying for a week, but we were creative, using every drawer and shelf, and it was OK. The Deluxe room came with a flat screen panel TV, while the superior room had an old fashioned tube TV.
reviews.title: Fantastic !

likes.liked: — The bathrooms are beautiful , top service

reviews.text: Glass enclosed showers, which doesn't work well for older children sharing a room. The shower in the superior room is very large, and comes with a rain shower as well as a hand held sprayer. The sink was a very attractive bowl design, but very little counter top space. Much more counter top space in the bathroom in the Deluxe room. Granite and marble and upscale fixtures throughout both bathrooms. Comfortable bathrobes.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent a few nights here back in August 2011 and had such a lovely time. We had a great luxury room, which was so big and roomy. The staff were very helpful and always available. One of the best features of this hotel is its location and close proximity to great shopping and restaurants. No complains and slept very well.
reviews.title: Great location and lovely
Very nice
reviews.text: I visit Montreal regularly but had not stayed here before. Lovely hotel, much nicer inside where it seems smaller than the tall apartment-style building you see from the outside. Room was very nice, small but super comfortable king-sized bed, corner room had windows on two walls, lovely bathroom, good quality towels, etc. but no tub which some people might want. Service twice a day. Bottle of water put by the bed at night plus classical music put on the radio for your return! No coffee machine which seems to be common in Sofitel hotels and has put me off staying in this chain previously. There is coffee in the lobby which I was concerned about due to a previous review saying the it was not good, so was expecting a pot to be sitting there with stale coffee. This coffee was excellent, individually made from an Italian machine, but not a horrible pod-type machine. So, if you like coffee in the morning, you have to go downstairs to get it. Staff all very nice and friendly, but valet parking, which is expensive, was slow, so allow time if you need your car in a hurry. There are outdoor parking lots a few blocks away, and free parking further west. .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a modern, clean hotel conveniently located for touring downtown Montreal. It was very cold when we were there so did not venture far from the hotel. Concierge directed us to a restaurant we were looking for and provided us with a complimentary dessert.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel for the price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is right downtown in Montreal only a few blocks from the Montreal Museum of Fine Arts. It is a modern hotel with all the amenities to be expected in a 4-5 star hotel. The service from the welcome and valet parking to the front desk and bellmen was excellent. We were attending a function with 160 people and the hors d'oeuvres and buffet dinner were excellent. Overall, a great experience and I would recommend this hotel to all.
reviews.title: French Hotel in French City

reviews.text: This hotel is placed right in the midst of everything. Close to theatre (Bell Centre), close to shopping and close to the train station. We didn't mind walking the few blocks as it was a beautiful day and there was so much activity on the streets ..not to be missed. The hotel is lovely, beds comfortable and overall room size and bathroom size exceeds expectations.
reviews.title: Lovely Stay

description: Considered among the best downtown Montreal hotels, Sofitel Montreal Le Carre Dore is located in the heart of the historic Golden Square Mile, at the corner of Stanley and Sherbrooke Streets. Near this downtown Montreal Canada hotel, you'll find the renowned McGill University, the Montreal Museum of Fine Arts, and art galleries and luxurious shopping venues. With works of contemporary art, intimate lighting, and expansive glass windows, our Sofitel Montreal hotel celebrates the French art de vivre.
